alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 1:33AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and southeast New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, Eastern Lincoln County. In southeast New Mexico, Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous thunderstorms are expected over the area this afternoon and evening. Rainfall rates over one inch per hour are likely, with the potential for flash flooding. Areas where the ground is already saturated from recent heavy rainfall, locations with steep terrain, and recent wildfire burn scars will be especially susceptible to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
